content.body: YieldExpression and AwaitExpressions are disallowed in the Initializer of FieldDefinitions, right? where is that checked for? i think i'm missing something
the grammar is passing along [?Yield, ?Await] and i don't see a special Early Error for it
yeah it should probably not be passed through to the rhs
at least for non-static fields; not sure about static
implementations don't accept either await or yield in both member and `static` AFAICT
content.formatted_body: implementations don't accept either await or yield in both member and static AFAICT

content.body:
heh, JSC allows it
```
$ eshost -h JavaScriptCore -sx 'const iter = (function*(){ return (class { static foo = yield }).foo; })(); iter.next(); print(JSON.stringify(iter.next(42)));'
#### JavaScriptCore
{"done":true}
```
content.formatted_body:
heh, JSC allows it

$ eshost -h JavaScriptCore -sx 'const iter = (function*(){ return (class { static foo = yield }).foo; })(); iter.next(); print(JSON.stringify(iter.next(42)));'
#### JavaScriptCore
{"done":true}

content.body: does it allow it for member fields?

m.new_content.formatted_body:
heh, JSC allows it

$ eshost -h JavaScriptCore -sx '
  const iter = (function*(){ return (class { static foo = yield }).foo; })(); 
  iter.next();
  print(JSON.stringify(iter.next(42)));
'
#### JavaScriptCore
{"done":true}

yes:

eshost -h JavaScriptCore -sx '
  const iter = (function*(){ return (new class { foo = yield }).foo; })();
  iter.next();
  print(JSON.stringify(iter.next(42)));
'
#### JavaScriptCore
{"done":true}

content.body: I really want to say I have production code that uses this behavior to detect JSC specifically.
